result.execSummary:
The defendant Turhan R. Gates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. 

Defendant must undergo a domestic violence evaluation and programming deemed appropriate by probation agent.

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen within 7 days. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with Victim 1 unless have consent of Victim 1 or probation agent.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.

defendant.name: Gates, Turhan R.

records.addlTxt:
Return to Sender, Box Closed, Unable to Forward
Victim Notice of Rights returned
Return to Sender, Unclaimed, Unable to Forward

1:57 PM Defendant Turhan R. Gates in court.  Attorney Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney April Lande in court for Turhan R. Gates. State in compliance with victim rights. Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1 & 3. Count 2 DRI. 
Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Counts 1 & 3, Disorderly Conduct contrary to 947.01(1) as a repeater 968.075(1)(a). Defendant exercised his right to allocution. 

Joint recommendation: 18 months probation, no contact with victim 1, without the consent of the victim or your probation agent. Domestic abuse programming and assessment follow through approved by agent. Risk and needs assessment.  Costs. 

Court adopts joint recommendation: Withholds sentence, 18 months probation. No contact with victim 1, unless you have  the consent of the victim or probation agent.  Domestic abuse assessment and follow through approved by agent. Risk and needs assessment. Costs. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen within the next 7 days. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.
